intro: Hauya longicornuta, commonly known as the longhorned hauya, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as cloud forests, where it thrives in the cool, humid climate. Hauya longicornuta is also noted for its medicinal properties, with local communities using various parts of the plant for traditional healing purposes.
